properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 3:02PM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TAKES AIM ON NORTH CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST
WASHINGTON...

.Our next winter storm will produce the heavy snow accumulations
over the north Cascades, Okanogan Valley, and the mountainous
portions of northeast Washington tonight into Thursday morning.
Accumulations of 4 to 8 inches will be common for counties along
the Canadian border.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7
inches in the valleys with 6 to 10 inches in the mountains.

* WHERE...Sandpoint, Bonners Ferry, Priest River, Eastport, and
Schweitzer Mountain Road.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow will likely fall during
the early to mid morning hours on Thursday. Additional light
snow will have the potential to produce additional light
accumulations Thursday afternoon.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST THURSDAY
